If good men and good women wish to pay respect to the Buddha, they should first make a vow and say:
'With utmost sincerity, I now bow to the Buddhas of the ten directions, universally entering all supreme dharmas.

I now prostrate to the Buddha with my five limbs, in order to sever the five destinies, to be free from the five hindrances, and to wish that all sentient beings may always abide in the five unimpeded spiritual powers and be endowed with the five eyes.
I wish that when my right knee touches the ground, may all sentient beings attain the path of right enlightenment.

I wish that when my left knee touches the ground, may all sentient beings not give rise to wrong views in the teachings of non-Buddhist paths, and may they all be established in the path of right enlightenment.

I wish that when my right hand touches the ground, just as the World-Honored One sat on the vajra seat, pointed to the ground with his right hand, shook the earth to manifest auspicious signs, and realized great enlightenment, so too am I now, together with all sentient beings, realizing the path of enlightenment.
I wish that when my left hand touches the ground, may those non-Buddhist practitioners who are difficult to subdue be embraced with the four means of magnetizing, and may they enter the true Dharma.
